result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Gramza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Probation may be transferred to the State of South Carolina as long as they can follow all conditions as set forth by this Court. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations. May not frequent taverns that just serve alcohol. May go to restaurants that serve alcohol but may not drink any. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.   Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation with no violations. whatsoever.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Steven M Gramza in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
The State indicates there are no Ch. 950 implications. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends w/held sent - 2 yrs prob; no alc/cs except by RX-UA's, AODA assessment, counseling by agent; FT emp/school = FT, 6 mos RCJ-CFTS and balance stayed. Defense agrees with probation and asks that the Court allow an interstate compact to South Carolina so deft can live with his brother.

BTC: sent w/held - 1 yr prob in 14CF997, 2 yrs prob in 14CF1743-conc with 14CF997. Transfer by interstate compact to South Carolina is approved as long as they can follow all conditions as set forth by this Court.
               MATTERS MAY BE EXPUNGED IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES PROBATION WITH NO VIOLATIONS WHATSOEVER

costs

May go to restaurants that serve alcohol but may not drink any

Defendant Steven M Gramza in court with attorney Kathleen Renee Lang.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
DOC has informed the Court that deft has not reported for PSI appointments and also a letter from defense. Defense indicates she spoke with the agent and if the deft can provide proof of employment, the agent no longer feels that the deft needs to be taken into custody. Defense asks for new PSI order. The State indicates that as long as he schedules his PSI appointment today the State does not request deft be taken in.

BTC: New PSI order to be done and new SEH date to be set  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Cancelled with Dispatch, Anchondo #9232, 01/05/15 @ 1:26 p.m.   ***Corrine at RPD/1:38PM/ds***

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 01-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
